identification.question: The power to interpret laws is vested in the ______ Department.
Who was the first President of the 5th Republic of the Philippines?
The fundamental law of the land is called the ______.
The 'writ of ______' commands the production of a detained person in court.
Who is the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of the Philippines?
The legislative power shall be vested in the ______ of the Philippines.
What is the minimum age requirement for a Philippine President?
RA 11954 established the ______ Investment Fund.
The President known for the 'Build, Build, Build' program.
The right to vote is also known as the right of ______.
No person shall be deprived of life, liberty, or property without ______ of law.
The term of office for a Senator is ______ years.
The President who used the slogan 'Erap para sa Mahirap'.
RA 11934 mandates the registration of ______ cards.
The intro to the Constitution is called the ______.
The Upper House of Congress is the ______.
The Lower House of Congress is the House of ______.
Who succeeded Ferdinand Marcos Sr. in 1986?
Fidel V. Ramos is known for his 'Philippines ______' vision.
The official residence of the President is ______ Palace.
Which branch has the power of the purse (budget)?
Article III of the 1987 Constitution is the ______.
The National Language of the Philippines is ______.
Who was the president during the 'Strong Republic' era?
How many Associate Justices are in the Supreme Court?
RA 11962 is known as the 'Trabaho Para sa ______' Act.
A law that punishes without trial is a Bill of ______.
Benigno Aquino III's campaign slogan was 'Daang ______'.
The current President (2025 context) is Ferdinand ______ Jr.
The power of the State to take private property for public use is ______ Domain.

true_false.question: Sovereignty resides in the people and all government authority emanates from them.
The President can run for re-election immediately after his term ends.
The Senate is composed of 24 Senators.
A search warrant can be issued without probable cause.
The Philippines is a democratic and republican State.
Joseph Estrada finished his full 6-year term as President.
Corazon Aquino was the first female President of the Philippines.
The Supreme Court is part of the Executive Branch.
Congress has the power to declare a state of war.
RA 11954 established the Maharlika Investment Fund.
The death penalty is currently active and enforceable in the Philippines.
A naturalized Filipino citizen can run for President.
Rodrigo Duterte served as Mayor of Davao City before becoming President.
The Bill of Rights is found in Article III of the Constitution.
Fidel V. Ramos was a military general before becoming President.
The Vice President is automatically a member of the Cabinet.
Civilian authority is supreme over the military at all times.
Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo is an economist by profession.
Benigno Aquino III is the son of Ferdinand Marcos.
The State guarantees the separation of Church and State.
A Member of the House of Representatives serves for 6 years.
The National ID has an expiration date for Filipino citizens.
Double jeopardy allows a person to be tried twice for the same offense.
The term of office of the President is 6 years.
RA 11934 requires SIM card registration to curb cybercrime.
The Judiciary makes the laws.
Senators are elected by district.
The Preamble is an integral part of the Constitution.
The President can veto a bill passed by Congress.
Ferdinand Marcos Jr. ran under the 'UniTeam' alliance.
